article:
'Light crude oil' is liquid petroleum that has a low density and flows freely at
room temperature. {{cite web
  | title = Glossary publisher = Canadian Association of Petroleum Producers
  | date = 2009 url = http://www.capp.ca/library/glossary/Pages/default.aspx#l
  | accessdate = 2009-08-15}}
  It has a low viscosity, low specific gravity and high API gravity due
 to the presence of a high proportion of light hydrocarbon fractions.
 {{cite web
  | title = Glossary of Petroleum Industry Common Terms & Symbols publisher =
  | Alken Murray Corp. date = 1999 url = http://www.alken-murray.com/fuel-
  | glossary.htm accessdate = 2009-08-15}}
  It generally has a low wax content. Light crude oil receives a higher
 price than heavy crude oil on commodity markets because it produces a higher
 percentage of gasoline and diesel fuel when converted into products by an
 oil refinery.
